intro: Calibanus hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's calibanus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, evergreen leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is typically found in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
